Name: CVE-2008-6393
Description: PSI Jabber client before 0.12.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a file transfer request with a negative value in a SOCKS5 option, which bypasses a signed integer check and triggers an integer overflow and a heap-based buffer overflow.

Name: CVE-2008-6502
Description: Directory traversal vulnerability in Pro Chat Rooms 3.0.2 allows remote authenticated users to select an arbitrary local PHP script as an avatar via a .. (dot dot) in the avatar parameter, and cause other users to execute this script by using sendData.php to send a message to (1) an individual user or (2) a room, leading to cross-site request forgery (CSRF), cross-site scripting (XSS), or other impacts.
References: EXPLOIT-DB:7409   |   URL:https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/7409   |   OSVDB:50697   |   URL:http://osvdb.org/50697   |   SECUNIA:33088   |   URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/33088   |   XF:prochatrooms-senddata-xss(47242)   |   URL:https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/47242

Name: CVE-2008-6503
Description: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in PrestaShop 1.1.0.3 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the PATH_INFO to (1) admin/login.php and (2) order.php.
References: BID:32689   |   URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/32689   |   BUGTRAQ:20081208 Two XSS Flaws in PrestaShop 1.1.0.3   |   URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/498994/100/100/threaded   |   XF:prestashop-login-order-xss(47158)   |   URL:https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/47158

Name: CVE-2008-6504
Description: ParametersInterceptor in OpenSymphony XWork 2.0.x before 2.0.6 and 2.1.x before 2.1.2, as used in Apache Struts and other products, does not properly restrict # (pound sign) references to context objects, which allows remote attackers to execute Object-Graph Navigation Language (OGNL) statements and modify server-side context objects, as demonstrated by use of a \u0023 representation for the # character.
References: BID:32101   |   URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/32101   |   CONFIRM:http://fisheye6.atlassian.com/cru/CR-9/   |   CONFIRM:http://issues.apache.org/struts/browse/WW-2692   |   CONFIRM:http://jira.opensymphony.com/browse/XW-641   |   CONFIRM:http://struts.apache.org/2.x/docs/s2-003.html   |   OSVDB:49732   |   URL:http://osvdb.org/49732   |   SECUNIA:32495   |   URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/32495   |   SECUNIA:32497   |   URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/32497   |   VUPEN:ADV-2008-3003   |   URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2008/3003   |   VUPEN:ADV-2008-3004   |   URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2008/3004   |   XF:xwork-parameterinterceptor-security-bypass(46328)   |   URL:https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/46328

Name: CVE-2008-6505
Description: Multiple directory traversal vulnerabilities in Apache Struts 2.0.x before 2.0.12 and 2.1.x before 2.1.3 allow remote attackers to read arbitrary files via a ..%252f (encoded dot dot slash) in a URI with a /struts/ path, related to (1) FilterDispatcher in 2.0.x and (2) DefaultStaticContentLoader in 2.1.x.
References: BID:32104   |   URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/32104   |   CONFIRM:http://issues.apache.org/struts/browse/WW-2779   |   CONFIRM:http://struts.apache.org/2.x/docs/s2-004.html   |   OSVDB:49733   |   URL:http://osvdb.org/49733   |   OSVDB:49734   |   URL:http://osvdb.org/49734   |   SECUNIA:32497   |   URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/32497   |   VUPEN:ADV-2008-3003   |   URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2008/3003

Name: CVE-2008-6506
Description: Unspecified vulnerability in phpBB before 3.0.4 allows attackers to bypass intended access restrictions and activate de-activated accounts via unknown vectors.
References: BID:32842   |   URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/32842   |   CONFIRM:http://www.phpbb.com/community/viewtopic.php?f=14&t=1352565   |   CONFIRM:http://www.phpbb.com/support/documents.php?mode=changelog&version=3#v303   |   MLIST:[oss-security] 20090206 CVE request: phpbb < 3.0.4   |   URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2009/02/06/2   |   OSVDB:50806   |   URL:http://www.osvdb.org/50806   |   SECUNIA:33166   |   URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/33166   |   XF:phpbb-account-activation-security-bypass(47370)   |   URL:https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/47370

Name: CVE-2008-6507
Description: Unspecified vulnerability in phpBB before 3.0.4 allows attackers to obtain sensitive information via unknown vectors related to the lack of password prompts for a private message that quotes a post in a password-protected forum.

Name: CVE-2008-6508
Description: Directory traversal vulnerability in the AuthCheck filter in the Admin Console in Openfire 3.6.0a and earlier allows remote attackers to bypass authentication and access the admin interface via a .. (dot dot) in a URI that matches the Exclude-Strings list, as demonstrated by a /setup/setup-/.. sequence in a URI.

Name: CVE-2008-6509
Description: SQL injection vulnerability in CallLogDAO in SIP Plugin in Openfire 3.6.0a and earlier allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary SQL commands via the type parameter to sipark-log-summary.jsp.

Name: CVE-2008-6510
Description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in login.jsp in the Admin Console in Openfire 3.6.0a and earlier allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the url parameter.

Name: CVE-2008-6511
Description: Open redirect vulnerability in login.jsp in Openfire 3.6.0a and earlier allows remote attackers to redirect users to arbitrary web sites and conduct phishing attacks via the url parameter.

Name: CVE-2008-6512
Description: Cross-domain vulnerability in the WorkerPool API in Google Gears before 0.5.4.2 allows remote attackers to bypass the Same Origin Policy and the intended access restrictions of the allowCrossOrigin function by hosting an assumed-safe file type containing Google Gear commands on the target domain, then accessing that file from the attacking domain, whose response headers are not checked and cause the worker code to run in the target domain.
References: BID:32698   |   URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/32698   |   CONFIRM:http://code.google.com/apis/gears/upcoming/api_workerpool.html#cross_origin   |   FULLDISC:20081208 Breaking Google Gears' Cross-Origin Communication Model   |   URL:http://lists.grok.org.uk/pipermail/full-disclosure/2008-December/066291.html   |   MISC:http://blog.watchfire.com/wfblog/2008/12/breaking-google-gears-cross-origin-communication-model.html   |   SECUNIA:33062   |   URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/33062   |   XF:gears-allowcrossorigin-security-bypass(47173)   |   URL:https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/47173

Name: CVE-2008-6513
Description: Unrestricted file upload vulnerability in saa.php in Andy's PHP Knowledgebase (aphpkb) 0.92.9 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by uploading a file with an executable extension, then accessing it via a link that is listed by authors.php.

Name: CVE-2008-6514
Description: The Expo plugin in Compiz Fusion 0.7.8 allows local users with physical access to drag the screen saver aside and access the locked desktop by using Expo mouse shortcuts, a related issue to CVE-2007-3920.

Name: CVE-2008-6515
Description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Fritz Berger yet another php photo album - next generation (yappa-ng) allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the query string to the default URI.
